thread.title: Work to fix South Hobart's 'blue box' house begins
thread.title_full: Work to fix South Hobart's 'blue box' house begins

title: Work to fix South Hobart's 'blue box' house begins
text:
South Hobart's 'blue box' house undergoes changes after failing to meet regulations Posted February 01, 2017 12:02:21 Map: South Hobart 7004 
Substantial work is under way on a South Hobart home dubbed the blue box, six months after a magistrate fined the owner and ordered him to adjust its height and re-clad it. 
Boacheng Xing was fined $8,000 in July 2016 for his failure to comply with the Hobart City Council's building regulations. 
Mr Xing was given 80 days to replace the cladding on the Lynton Avenue building and re-flash the windows. 
It followed a long-running effort by the council, which first found the house exceeded height restrictions during an inspection in 2012. 
The deadline for Mr Xing to fix up the dilapidated house expired in October. 
The council is now pursuing him in the Supreme Court for a breach of the court order. 
However, Mr Xing has lodged a building application and has begun re-cladding the house. 
The council hopes the work will be completed within the next few weeks. 
Mr Xing is due to appear in court next week.
